title: Meet the London boutique owner who helped shape the Duchess of Cambridge’s royal tour wardrobe
text:
Since arriving in Pakistan for the royal tour, the Duchess of Cambridge has worn a savvy mix of pieces from British and Pakistani designers: a Catherine Walker & Co salwar kameez-inspired outfit for her arrival, a periwinkle-blue silk kurta and trousers by local designer Maheen Khan to start day two, and a Walker-Khan outfit for lunch with Prime Minister Imran Khan.

Her outfits have been received as powerful symbols of the royals’ respect and appreciation for their hosts. For that, she can thank her team - and London boutique owner Onita Prasada.

Kate’s assistants first encountered Khan’s designs during a visit to O’nitaa, Prasada’s Chelsea boutique, which specialises in designer fashion from...
